response.summary: As an Agricultural Engineer my experience has been oriented to the development of projects country wide. I am a proactive, responsible person. I have good communication and listening skills, with high sensitivity and empathy to establish new relationships. I have leadership skills to work in environments under pressure. I am always willing to work in a team to create new solutions. In addition, I am a person looking for my actions to improve the quality of rural life and thus contribute to the construction of a better country.
response.skills: Software CRM, Comunicación, Problem Solving, Research, Leadership, Project Management, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Management, Public Speaking, Inglés, Análisis de datos, Microsoft Outlook

profile_positions.description:
Prospect, identify, and develop new partners and territories.
Select content and opportunities to engage and empower partners in Arable's mission and technology.
Collaborate with the Arable Marketing team to share partner stories and successes around the added value for producers and researchers.
Monitor performance and align incentives to meet program objectives.
Build relationships and open dialogue with partners to identify product needs, shared branding strategies, and optimize logistics.
Review achievement of targets, incentives, and growth opportunities in regular sessions of structured feedback.
profile_positions.title: Sales Development Representative

profile_positions.company: Etagro y C.I.A. S. C. S.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

company.name: Arable
company.description:
Arable, the leader in crop intelligence, advances digital agriculture globally. Forward-thinking agribusinesses, farming operations, and food and beverage companies use Arable to be more productive, sustainable, and profitable. Arable’s intuitive IoT-based solution combines reliable in-field weather, forecast, plant, soil, and irrigation data with advanced modeling and machine learning to deliver real-time, actionable insights into the entire crop system. Arable helps customers around the globe optimize water use, crop protection, fertilization, field work, research trials, food supply chains, and sustainability initiatives.

Arable and its innovations have been recognized in Fast Company’s “Next Big Things in Tech” list, as AgTech Breakthrough’s “Crop Monitoring Solution of the Year” and “IoT Monitoring Solution of the Year”, in Plug & Play’s “10 Precision Agriculture Companies to Watch” roundup, and in SVG Ventures | THRIVE’s “Top 50 Companies” list.

Arable is venture-backed by Galvanize Climate Solutions, Qualcomm Ventures, Prelude, S2G, Ajax Strategies, Grupo Jacto, Middleland, M2O, and iSelect.

The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California, with offices in Piracicaba, Brazil, and Bangalore, India. For more information, visit www.Arable.com.
